title: Ticket #3784: Memory Tracking Test - Waiting for ending from TJ
description:
Memory Tracking Test

job_memory_tracking

We want to ensure reported memory after a job completes is the high water mark for resident memory used and that we have consistency in the image size reported to the user log and that we have the same values in the machine and job ads.

We first need a job that will grow and shrink on demand.

Having that, we want to check for various memory ads(Job and Machine) but need to be able to get callbacks on Image Size Updated(have these call backs now).

Discovered with this test that though we have all these callbacks for events, they were not able to impact global variables in the tests. The monitor process was the child of a fork and thus had it's own copies to update.

This is no longer the way it is. Now the test framework starts the monitor and when the monitor completes, the status is returned for the test. So we ping pong between the monitor and the test callbacks. Yet we are in a single process now.

The globals we care about are the arrays of hashes of slot ads and jobs ads collected on each image update callback and the image update counter.
